track.name: Shorty Wanna Be A Thug
comments: "I tell you it's a cold world - stay in school, you tell me it's a man's world - play the rules and fade fools -  break rules until we major".
love this beat.... Pac the greatest.

LGS, you may be retarded; he left Death Row and the Illuminati-assisted evil influence of Suge Knight to start Amaru as a separate imprint with his "Don Killuminati" persona.  His last album he dropped when he was alive was all about the Law of 7, karma, martyrdom, prophecy, and what's really good with hip-hop.  Suge Knight was one of the most powerful executives in hip-hop back then but Pac spoke to the people and he wasn't gonna keep selling his soul to the occultic brainwashing syndicates.  You've gotta be huffing paint thinner if you think he would've allowed himself to be relegated to a "bubblegum rapper", LOLSMH.

@wyteboy. I doubt it verrrrrrry much that he would have 'regulated' shit. Do you remember the man who used to 'own' him? I'd bet you all the money in the world he'd be a bubblegum rapper for Death Row today if he were still alive.
